comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I love a puzzle!  Firstly, the image needs horizontal flipping - see the number plate of the motorcycle bottom right - "34995".   1920s?  Winter? People coming and going?  ...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Indeed you can see the number plate! It would be great if this image was clearer so we could see the destination printed on the tram. I don't know how you were able to spot 'Street' or 'Beach', great eyesight! :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] My eyesight is shocking from looking at these wonderful old photos, but I think I have an answer . . . Crowds near South Head (due to trams) going to watch the arrival of the American Fleet early morning (long shadows) on Thursday 23 July (winter coats) 1925. trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16233521 trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16233546 Or not?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: OR ... The departure of the US Fleet on Thursday 6 August 1925. See SMH from the following day - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16213029. The Fleet began leaving at 11am. Remarkably there are no children around - a school day? And maybe the traffic jam is caused as everyone is leaving?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Tentative location at the junction of New South Head Road (the old tram route) and Hopetoun Avenue in Vaucluse. The image needs flipping, so it is difficult to compare with the GoogleMapsStreetView - maps.google.com.au/maps?ll=-33.859253,151.273954&spn=...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Wow, thank you for all that research beachcomber and apologies for the delay in replying. That looks about right! Certainly right about the weather though, they look like they're rugged up in their furs.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: I am quite unconvinced this is the corner of Hopetoun Road and Old South Head Road.  The road alignment looks quite wrong,   and that house on the left should be a church and it isn't.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Outstanding work as always. I second your tentative motion.
